intro: Orchis speciosissima, commonly known as the showy orchis, is a striking member of the Orchidaceae family native to Europe and parts of Asia. This perennial herbaceous plant typically grows to a height of 40–80 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves and a tall, erect stem. Its most distinctive feature is the showy, purple or violet flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodlands and meadows. Orchis speciosissima plays an important role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
